snippet: The former leader of the Jamaat-e-Islami party, which opposed Bangladeshi independence, was convicted of crimes committed during the country’s 1971 war.
abstract: Bangladeshi war crimes tribunal sentences Ghulam Azam, aged but still powerful Islamist who was former leader of Jamaat-e-Islami party, to 90 years in jail for crimes committed during country’s 1971 war for independence from Pakistan; verdict draws fury from those who find  punishment either too harsh or too weak.
lead_paragraph: The former leader of the Jamaat-e-Islami party, which opposed Bangladeshi independence, was convicted of crimes committed during the country’s 1971 war.
